Dave Astels wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Ilja Preuss" <preuss@d...> wrote:
>> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>>> I am looking for opinions on the pro side of using inner classes to
>>> test the private parts of a class. Since I don't use the technique
>>> myself, I don't know whether there is any advantage to this
>>> technique, other than it works. (I could also use JUnitX without
>>> cluttering up my source code.)
>> 
>> To me, cluttering up the source code *is* an advantage in this case.
>> Testing private parts is a smell - if I need to do it, I want the
>> smell to be felt every time I need to work with it, I want it to be
>> ugly.
> 
> Very well said.

Thanks! :)
